intro: Tapeinanthus brahuicus, commonly known as the Brahui tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically ovate or elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in axillary or terminal inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds. Tapeinanthus brahuicus is often found in dry, thorny scrublands and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
